My body is a relief map in eruption Wrinkles wrinkles wrinkles riddle the landscape Pimples keep on erecting and detumescing all the time My face swells and subsides and always finishes older I have one or.two grey hairs among the hairs around my J testicles I give my eyeballs everyday marks for yellowness and I blow my nose hard each morning to find out how deaf I am My handkerchieves are filled with snot W hen I make love I do it fiercely several nights in a row As if it were the last time each time Then go on the booze for a fortnight Insulting my dear wife with silences When I wake at four in the morning There are always two landscapes inside One is the mess one has made of one\u2019s human life (I can say it only in dreams I am always trapped in the leaking submarine, the^ ^executioner taps on the door I am always back at school or in the army Having lost my rifle not read Beowulf) TwoisAloe-gnrgling and splashing and undermining in thi () bowels The snuffle in the bronchi and the sinuses Orchestrating with bloody birds and aeroplanes outside Cancer has captured this town and that town one says , , \n￼P^ini One gets up makes tea Discusses the possible public image with the shaving-mirror Trims the beard sharp One walks into the sunlight rehearsing wisecracks ^. One\u2019s wife will, mercifully, give one breakfast Consents to gossip. \n￼Senilio\u2019s W eather Saw If Church spire be clear Twill be daamp round here If it be not Twill be bloody hot When thee caan\u2019t see spire Church be on fire ■k- And we\u2019ll hang parson, squire And the whole bleeding choir. \\Z \n￼It Js the Blight Man Was Born For Don\u2019t knock the door. She\u2019s not at home To chat of Crabbe\u2019s or Cowper\u2019s verse\u2014 Miss Austen\u2019s got the curse again, This time, worse. * Strides over the moors A recalcitrant Amazon\u2014 Emily Bronte W ith the jam-rags on. Tears are replaced by Crimson confetti\u2014 Goblins get hold of Christina Rossetti. 4r Poor girls, I bleed for you. At the back of the room appeared -«■ A girl, Clear and radiant, Piercing. I glanced. Stammered again. She went on shining, quietly. 24h P ^ lob/ll b&W IT Senilio to Christine ^ \u2014--- Thus Louis Jouvet with his fine rolling of R\u2019s - \u2018Ah! Condemned to some machine With whirring blades Mincing to dog-meat. To be tinned. It was true. I was cut into Gobbets. How they flew! But I\u2019m back now, not tinned, An old dog with Intelligent eyes. I^^V^nother Letter to the Moon \\ I p 'U ■r i it Y our re-appearance \\ New as Laura Restored my sanity 4r How refreshing a cup Of water, cool friendship And how flattering W ith Primavera stockings And a talent for verse. 3opti # D <£-VI iRS^fHaiku) Moon, I too Can spell: C, h, r, i, s, t, i, n, e ... hd<S 1£ \n￼Mrj Hobsbaum\u2019s Monday Evening Meeting I Tradition\u2019s fine-meshed sieve will sift Each man\u2019s re-gurgitated toad. The thin pulse of the word must drift Up the vague tides of Edg^ware Road. \u2014$ - They jostle in the crowded room Severely, not to be out-done In rich Antipodean glcom By MrsJPorter\u2019s favourite son. Below the ceiling, guardian of the Grail The ghost of Drj Leavis floats. A trim breeze stirs the fragile sails Of Lucie-Smith\u2019s expensive boats. -* \u2018Another spider!\u2019 groan the flies, And stagger down the autumnal grove: The honest gardener\u2019s mouse-bound eyes Protest that he decays for love. At Poems condemned must lose their bowels: Knit brows acclaim the execution-\u2014 Expressive consonants, rich vowels ladies trained in elocution. A slow breeze stirs a beard Lear-sized (Edward not King) to stringent rage: \u2018Not in the poem! It\u2019s not realised! \u2018An abstract statement on the page!\u2019 niskj-\u2014-3^.f\\z \n￼With a Presentation Copy of Verses How nice to know Mr^ MacBeth, That Harlequin glinter and frisker! What a gay air of \u2018I\u2019m Colonel Death!\u2019 Sets twitching each end of his whisker. 4 His appearance is feline and elegant. He is certain of each fact he states. His spectacles prove he\u2019s intelligent. His degree is a good one (in Greatsj), \u2022fc May the verse-form remove my remarks A little bit higher than platitude; Though we\u2019re off after different Snarks, Accept this book, George, with my gratitude. Hemingway, Jimmy Bond, and D\u2019Annunzio Are not in my line and you know it\u2014 You would surely have been Papal Nuncio If you were not (hdlas) a good poet. May History\u2019s mischievous glass Not show us out of our decades, With me primly holding the pass, And you at the barricades.
